pageTitle: Annual Park Roads and Parking - Capital Improvement Program, City of Columbia, MO
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {74500=Project Notes: Phase 2 of the Garth Nature Area parking lot expansion was funded out of 2009 Annual Park Roads and Parking, with a budget of $28,290. The remaining road and parking lot projects were awarded to Frech Paving company in the amount of $79,824.71, PO#091704. The second round of bids for asphalt work was also awarded to Frech Paving Company in the amount of $49,657, PO#092542., 87219=Project Description: Frech Paving Company was awarded the bid in the amount of $109,006.33, PO #072168, for the 2007 park roads and parking projects listed below., 64771=Project Description: Park road and parking lot improvements in Columbia's park system. List of projects is determined annually. Projects chosen for FY 2010 funding are listed below., 84466=Project Description:2008 projects are listed below. Other alternate projects may be added, as funding allows.}
textBeforeTable: Project Status: One project completed. Staff is preparing bid specs for other projects. Project Manager: Toney Lowery, Sr. Park Planner, 573-874-7537, AJLowery@GoColumbiaMo.com Project Description: Park road and parking lot improvements in Columbia's park system. List of projects is determined annually. Park Sales Tax Funding Source: $150,000 Project Budget: C00242 Project Number: 2015 Funding Fiscal Year: 2015 Annual Park Roads and Parking Projects FY2015 FY 2014 FY 2013 FY 2012 FY 2011 FY 2010 FY 2009 FY 2008 FY 2007 Funds are budgeted annually, when available, in the Capital Improvement Program for improvements to park roads and parking.This provides a funding source to upgrade existing park roads and parking lots as they deteriorate. Work often consists of asphalt overlays or sealing. New parking lots are sometimes packaged with the maintenance projects to obtain a better bid price. These improvements help maintain the quality and safety standards that have been established for park roads and parking areas. Funds not used in one fiscal year roll over to the next fiscal
